QAPair.Question: What is (are) Phantom limb pain ?
QAPair.Answer: After one of your limbs is amputated , you may feel as if the limb is still there. This is called phantom sensation. You may feel: Pain in your limb even though it is physically not there, Tingly, Prickly, Numb, Hot or cold, Like your missing toes or fingers are moving, Like your missing limb is still there, or is in a funny position, Like your missing limb is getting shorter (telescoping) ,
